name: Sofitel Los Angeles at Beverly Hills

reviews.text: We stayed here for two nights and absolutely loved it. First time at a Sofitel. The room was immaculate very modern the beds divine. The concierge was so helpful with every little thing we asked.The Beverly hills mall with Bloomies and Macys right across the street, CVS, Marshalls Old Navy and Starbucks also across the street. Within walking distance of Robertson. We did not eat at Simons but heard it was excellent. Great neighbourhood in the area for walking. Will definitely stay at Sofitel next chance I get.
reviews.title: Sofitel won me over!!

likes.liked: — Great service from doorman to concierge

reviews.text: Just returned after a 6 day trip .Chose this hotel as i have stayed in a few of the sofitels , and found them great .This was ... well ok. Clean hotel , small rooms , helpful reception staff , but concierge made 3 mistakes in requests we made , and one was pretty major , and spoilt our last nite.And location is not great .Apart from a shopping mall across from hotel , theres nothing else within walking distance.Probably would not stay again .
reviews.title: Just returned

reviews.text: I stayed at the Sofitel for 2 nights and it was one of the best hotel of my month long stay in the USA. Stunning modern lobby (although the several doormen 'welcoming' you back to the hotel each time you enter is a little annoying!). There are 3 computers to the side of the reception desk offering free internet access. I didnt dine at the restaurant as looked a little expensive but it looked extremely nice and the adjoining bar loks very funky! I recommend a restaurant called the Grand Lux Cafe just down the road from the hotel - delicious burgers!
reviews.title: Great hotel!

reviews.text: The room was stunning with really comfortable beds and large bathroom. The only down side was the size of the pool and surrounding area - very small although the space is put to great use with lots of plants and a few lovely secluded seating booths with tvs in. You are not aware of the busy road below. The rooms have fluffy bathrobes and slippers which are handy for the walk down to the pool.
reviews.title: Central location and great service

reviews.text: Another down side was the concierge who was rather snotty and not very friendly. The staff at reception however were very friendly.
reviews.title: average

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After seeing some of the reviews, I immediately requested a room facing the Hollywood Hills. The room was beautiful (6th floor), and you could see the Hollywood sign. We had a superior room, which I didn't feel was very small- then again, we're from NYC and used to apartments. It was very comfortable and quiet, with a great bathroom. The hotel staff was friendly and helpful. We actually didn't valet, and found street parking, which was a little stressful, but saved us $100. Be very careful of the street signs. We were moving the car at 8AM each morning, which was fine, still being on East Coast time. The pool area was nice, but smaller than the pictures. Overall, a very nice stay.
reviews.title: Better than expected

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for two nights. The room we booked was a King Superior with "some hills view". The room we were gives was a King room on the 8th floor but directly on Beverly Boulevard, with a view of the shopping center.
reviews.title: Noisy hotel, lack of service

reviews.text: We got into the elevators and noticed they were not very clean, this continued throughout our stay, as did trash that was not picked up the entire stay. Hallway carpets were dirty and stained.
reviews.title: Gorgeous hotel. Wonderful stay.

likes.disliked: — Valet parking ... always annoys me though.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was small but clean, but very noisy. We could hear the traffic on Beverly and the people in the room next to us, especially when you were in the bathroom. We had to keep the bathroom door closed at night to keep the noise out.
reviews.title: 2nd Time at this hotel, very centrally located

reviews.text: The bed was the worst I have ever slept in. It was lumpy and uneven from the mattress cover, there was no headboard only a 4" gap between the bed and the wall where they had placed electrical strips. The down comforter was so heavy and hot you couldn't sleep under it, and there was no top sheet on the bed, so it was cover or nothing. Noisy A/C too.
reviews.title: Great hotel, terrible room

likes.liked: — Great showers, great staff, great facility, great location, great spa
likes.disliked: — The noise from outside was rediculous.

reviews.text: I'd read all the great reviews on Tripadvisor before we went to the Los Angeles Sofitel in March this year and was excited about our visit, but found the reality didn't quite live up to its billing. It is a nice hotel, but the rooms on the mall side of the building are loud (no noise glass, french doors that didn't even close all the way) , small and not very special. The lobby is very dark and pretentious. The surrounding immediate area offers nothing except a mall, nothing of interest or charm is walkable from the hotel (I know it is LA, but still...). Though expensive, the restaurant does do a delicious breakfast. The concierge gave excellent directions and was very helpful in general. It wasn't a bad place, but it lacked charm, quiet and distinction. I would not stay there again.
reviews.title: Noisy and Dark

likes.disliked: — rooms were lack luster, pool a joke, whole place was very pretentious

reviews.text: I only had a short stay in LA for business and decided to stay at the Sofitel as l had never stayed at this hotel previously. It is located directly across the road from Beverly Shopping Centre so it is definately a convenient location for some shopping. l believe there are other hotels in better locations(ie Santa Monica) with better views(the view from my room was basically the shopping centre).
reviews.title: Decent hotel, good service

reviews.text: I stayed in an executive suite and the room was decent. It was slightly smaller than l expected..the suite photos shown on the internet show a larger lounge room however my lounge area was quite small. The balcony was overlooking the street and the Beverly Centre. The bedroom was large, clean, comfortable and nicely decorated. The bathrooms were decent sized with a tv above the bath - very nice. The room service was very prompt and the food was delicious. The staff are very professional and very eager to please - great service!
reviews.title: I'll be back!!

reviews.text: I would not stay at this hotel again as l prefer to try new hotels in different locations however l would recommend it to others.
reviews.title: Great Service and Family Friendly

likes.disliked: — A little on the pricey side.

reviews.text: We were overbooked by the Hyatt Regency Plaza and they put us in the Sofitel. It turned out to be a blessing in disguise as the Sofitel was perfect for our 1st trip to LA. The location couldnt be better as all the best West Hollywood shops were within a few minutes walk.... Melrose, Sunset and Hollywood Blvd etc. Santa Monica is 10 mins drive and the valet parking was seamless. The room was briliiant. Great bed with all the usual amenities and a superb view of downtown LA. A little strange that there was a window in the bathroom looking out into the sleeping area?? But this is LA right?? The food in the Simon LA restaurant was top class. Try the ahi tuna if you like that sort of thing!!
reviews.title: Could be nicer!

likes.disliked: — The noise woke me up several times--they need better doors and slam stoppers

reviews.text: The Sofitel Los Angeles is a nice hotel. The service staff are friendly and efficient and the hotel and rooms are very clean. In my opinion, the double-bed room was surprisingly small. I guess for the price per night, I expected it to be bigger. I am a Sofitel rewards member; however, they neglected to provide me with the membership benefits even though my rewards status was clearly provided on the reservation. The bedroom windows open out to a main street and the Beverly Center is directly across the street, so great shopping is close. I didn't like the fact that the window looks like it has a balcony, but it doesn't, and one misstep could land you on your face in the street below. There's a Rande Gerber bar/lounge in the lobby that is frequented by the young and beautiful Los Angelenos. If you stay at the hotel you cross the velvet rope hassle-free. They also have a really nice restaurant with an outdoor patio which is perfect for brunch. Overall, the hotel was nice. Definitely not the best hotel I've stayed in, but certainly not the worst - just pricey. If it had cost less, my review would be more positive.
reviews.title: Overrated for the price

reviews.text: A great location I think that the comments about noise are unfair but would advise that you ask them at check in. The bed was incredibly comfy, the room OK.
reviews.title: Great value

reviews.text: The Sofitel Los Angeles was great.
reviews.title: Great place to stay in a great country loved it :)
Welcome Luxury
reviews.text: The location was perfect right opposite The Beverly Centre for all your shopping needs under one roof. The hotel is very clean and tidy and all the staff were there to help you in any way possible. The rooms were always kept clean and there was never a shortage of towels. I must say i have never slept as well as i did in their beds they were to die for!!! The Valet car parking service was really good as you only had to make one call and the car was parked outside ready to go on a short journey to Santa Monica and Malibu. Overall it was fantastic and couldn't fault it at all well done to everyone who made my stay fantastic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A very professional service extended throughout the hotel. We arrived late after a delayed flight and it was a relief to check into such a luxurious room with delightfully comfy beds!
reviews.title: Good but not great !

likes.disliked: — Small room,noise from various sources,over popular bar/restaurant.

reviews.text: I just attended a work meeting at the Sofitel in L.A. Let me start by saying that I live in L.A. all my life (37 years) and have seen many hotel both in L.A. and around the country. The Sofitel is a very modern, upscale hotel since the remodel. Everything from the lobby accents to the rooms are polished to a high sheen. Check in was easy as was check out. We used several meeting rooms while there and the catering service was outstanding. Food was top notch and the service always came with a smile. Actually, that theme spread throughout the hotel. I have to say I was not expecting a hotel in this area to have such a friendly, outgoing staff. Everyone who worked there greeted me as I walked by. They really made you feel welcome. We had over 50 people in town for our meetings from around the country and those I spoke to gave grand reviews.
reviews.title: A Modern Gem in L.A.!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I think the location is very good. You have the Beverly Center just South for shopping and a lot of food and entertainment within walking distance. You're close enough to the Sunset Strip to jump a short cab ride to get there but far enough to stay away from it if you don't want to be right in the thick of Hollywood.
reviews.title: A great choice for limited shopping time

reviews.text: It's L.A. so things are a little pricey but you do get the best. Room service was delicious. The bar/lounge is very cool. Wed night is the big night at the Stone Rose lounge. It gets BEYOND packed.
reviews.title: Don't stay here

reviews.text: The only note I would make if I returned would be to get a room on the South side of the hotel. There is a school as other reviewers have mentioned. It's located on the North side of the hotel where my room was. I had to be up early for meetings anyway but the noise from the school on weekday mornings could be an issue for anyone who wished to sleep in.
reviews.title: A wonderful stay at Sofitel Los Angeles

likes.disliked: — kids`noises from the elementary school opposite the hotel

reviews.text: A fantastic place with great customer service!
reviews.title: Fun, Stylish Hotel

reviews.text: Overrated and overpriced, the rooms are not extraordinary, but admittedly stylish and well-equipped, dimensions notwithstanding. The art is great, especially in the lobby. On weekend nights it seems to be a hopping place for Hollywood wannabes and other LA types. The "morning-after" breakfast/brunch scene in the restaurant was a hangover gone bad, with too loud music (DJ brunch? Obnoxious.), pretentious and pricey menu, and staff attitude. With so many hotel choices in this area, this one can be overlooked.
reviews.title: Overly SO-SO Sofitel
Goos times at the Sofitel
reviews.text: Good staff. Attentive and sorted out a housekeeping oversight quickly and with a free breakfast. It was a bad oversight.

Look/Feel. It's modern and refurbished. Like any hotel its worn but overall very nice. The beds are to die for. The shower heads (rain type) all need to be replaced due to shoddy manufacturing. They spray the roof causing bubbling paint and cold water to drip.
reviews.title: No individual treatment

reviews.text: Ask for the side with the view of the hills.
reviews.title: A great stay for LA shopping!
Absolutely loved this place!
reviews.text: The location is good. Easy to get cabs, away from the noise of the strip, close to the fun places you want to go.

description: Sofitel Los Angeles at Beverly Hills is a stunning hotel in LA offering elegant luxury accommodations and dramatic decor with an ambiance that combines see-and-be-seen excitement and the calm of an urban resort.Ideally situated on the corner of La Cienega and Beverly Boulevard opposite the Beverly Shopping Center this West Hollywood hotel is conveniently located near Cedar Sinai Medical Center Rodeo Drive Melrose Avenue and Sunset Boulevard.Discover a unique blend of French fashion mixed with Hollywood glamour at this elegant hotel.Choose from 295 rooms on 10 floors including 26 suites and two Imperial Suites all featuring Sofitel's luxurious feather top and duvet sleep system - SoBed.Savor the distinctive and delicious cuisine of the Mediterranean at Estérel, our new contemporary French restaurant.
